resources.string: Task Manager
Tasks
Task Info
Get groceries
Food in the fridge is running out. Need to resupply as soon as I can…

Some of the food in the fridge is running out. Need to resupply as soon as I can… So far what I need is
 - Milk
 - Eggs
 - Bread
 - Vegetables
 - Ground Beef
 Expiration dates should be within the next 3 months at the very LEAST, but the further ahead the better.
Complete daily workout
Gotta stay in shape!

Usual routine:
 - Warm up with some stretches for 5 minutes.
 - 20 push-ups
 - 20 squats
 - 20 lunges
 - Hour-long walk, 30-minute jog, or 45-minute cycling session
 - End it off with 5 more minutes of stretching and a good meal
Write a Blog post
I\'ve been watching some extremely good shows lately. I should share my opinions on at least one of them…

I've been watching some extremely good shows lately. I should share my opinions on at least one of them. I'm mostly an anime watcher, but I guess it wouldn't hurt to smuggle in an indie-animated show for a change. For the former, I'd probably write about My Hero Academia, for the latter I'd write about Murder Drones. Both of them are 10/10s. 

 Things to include in the blog post:
 - Plot summary
 - Animation quality and visual design
 - Character discussions; who I like, who I don't like
 - Soundtrack!!!
 - Overall score out of 10
Finish programming assignment
I should really get this Operating Systems assignment done…

We\'re supposed to build a tiny Unix shell using C, but it\'s proving a lot more challenging than I thought it\'d be. My implementation\'s batch mode does not seem to be working, and it seems to be an issue with the file reading itself, especially at the end… \n\n UPDATE: After talking it out with my dad, he proposed an excellent idea. Instead of reading the file for a single line and then parsing it to execute that line\'s commands before moving on to the next line, why don\'t I just read the entire file and store each line in a massive array of character arrays? That way I can read the file once at the beginning of runtime and then be done with it. That should take care of the batch mode bug. Just gotta get to coding it!
Read Chapter 14 of Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
I\'m not usually one for reading, but Harry Potter is great…

The plot thickens, and things are getting interesting. Mad-Eye Moody is an interesting character to say the least but he\'s quickly becoming one of my favorites. That scene with Draco in chapter 13 was funny as hell.
Plan a weekend trip
College has been stressing me out lately. Better have a mini-vacation soon…

I want to go somewhere fun this weekend to take my mind off all the nonstop schoolwork I've been doing lately. The question is where? I have a few ideas in mind, just gotta settle on one.
 - The condo on the beach my family owns.
 - A trip to Taboga Island
 - Crashing at my friend's place
Organize my computer
Running out of space, need to clean up.

1. Move all schoolwork and material from the previous year to cloud storage.
 2. Uninstall any games I haven't played in a while.
 3. Use my computer's storage check to see what are the largest files I have stored.
 4. Delete the ones deemed unimportant.
Complete the next milestone in side programming course
I\'m taking a Java programming course on the side, need to continue…

I\'m taking a Java programming course on the side, need to continue… Having taken programming courses with C++ and Python before, I really only have to learn the syntax, but it can still be a challenge with how cluttery Java\'s syntax can be.
Practice Italian
Reinforce basic Italian and practice/learn more.
Get used to hearing the Italian language by watching a movie of my choice in its Italian dub, and also practice the reading, writing, and pronunciation with tools like Duolingo.
Help a friend with college
I wonder how Connor is holding up with college…
Connor said he wanted to get back to college at some point and try coding again, so I\'d like to help him in any way possible. After all, coding may be fun, but it\'s also very rigorous.
Call my mother
Call my mother and catch up, while also reassuring her.

Call my mother and catch up, while also reassuring her. She is out of work at about 7 or 8 P.M., so that is my cue to call her and ask how she has been. I should probably remind her of the upcoming family dinner too.
